author: brycem
body:
Incorrect SHA hashes in Dockerfiles:   https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases

Steps to reproduce
------------------
On a Win10 machine with current bits and container support installed, run command:
docker build https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/master/docker/release/nanoserver/Dockerfile

Expected behavior
-----------------
success

Actual behavior
---------------
Name                           Value
----                           -----
CLRVersion
PSEdition                      Core
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSVersion                      5.1.14393.1000
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
WSManStackVersion              3.0
BuildVersion                   10.0.14393.1000
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
FullBuildString: 14393.0.amd64fre.rs1_release.160715-1616
OperatingSystem: Windows Server 2016 Datacenter ServerDatacenterNano Nano Server
[3F5FD873B6E3062D9741B019BC645E6F20999BE66B2FDAA4374495FEBEDD0E03] does not
match [257D5F081C112713DF17F6D0E4CBC794E5099664EDA8DBC543B996915834D5CE]!
At line:1 char:681
+ ... L_SHA256) { Throw [String]$('['+$ZipHash+'] does not match ['+$Env:PO ...
+                 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : OperationStopped: ([3F5FD873B6E306...996915834D5
   CE]!:String) [], RuntimeException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : [3F5FD873B6E3062D9741B019BC645E6F20999BE66B2FDAA
   4374495FEBEDD0E03] does not match [257D5F081C112713DF17F6D0E4CBC794E509966
  4EDA8DBC543B996915834D5CE]!
title: Incorrect SHA hash for Alpha.14
